main event: A round, brightly lighted object was observed for 15 minutes on August 3, 1961.
interesting points: The sighting involved a stable object observed visually on the ground., The object was initially lighted and was assumed to be a satellite by the observing official., The object was first sighted at 0225Z and disappeared at 0249Z., It was noted that the object had the shape of a pea and was bright as a first magnitude star., The sighting was confirmed by the commanding officer and five bridge watch standers.
witness description: commanding officer and five bridge watch standers
